OOC:  I disagree, AGAIN.  Using the scanned DNA, the transformers take form=
(beast mode) of the animal that the DNA belongs too.  Thus, having a fracti=
on of DNA.

  From: Jonathan 
  To: nbwrpg@y=
ahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 4:24 PM
  Subject: Re: =
All Read: Important


  OOC:

  Transformers don't have DNA... they use DNA=
 scans to select an alternate form but beyond that they're still technologi=
cal life forms....wasn't til BM that this fact was bastardized.

    ----- =
Original Message ----- 
    From: Jeepers Creepers 
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogro=
ups.com

om

 Read: Important


      i got an idea once a char is killed they dont come=
 back 

        Jonathan <jhogan@...> wrote: 

        Anyway=
 I was going to rant on about how a sequel wouldn't be all that
        dif=
ferent from a restart but I figured why bother?

        When I hit the end=
 of my long typed out rant I hit the problem. The real
        one. Another=
 person posted that characters are not allowed to die
        currently...h=
e is utterly incorrect.

        The problem is the role-playing 101 aspect=
. People are given the
        responsibility to judge how much damage they=
 take...however as we've seen
        some can't role-play their way out of=
 a wet paper bag let alone responsibly
        judge how much damage their =
character takes. When a bot does get damaged
        what typically happens=
 here?

        Here's the list:

        1) The enemy bot suddenly becomes=
 cockeyed unable to hit the broad side of a
        barn even if he was a g=
1 and standing over it.

        2) The bot never gives chase to his prey. =
It always lets the long time
        character slip away.

        3) A sho=
rt stay (a few hours usually) in the CR chamber and any damage is
        c=
ompletely gone.

        4) The character "dies" but faked his death coming=
 back as an enemy
        infiltrator.

        5) Character "dies" but an =
evil clone appears which after various meeting
        with colleagues or "=
loved ones" turns good again. Personality reverts to
        pre-evil clone=
.

        6) Character "dies" but is reborn as a more powerful offspring. =
Personality
        is hardly different.

        7) Character "dies" but t=
he players 6 other characters cart it's blasted
        carcass back to a l=
ab where they resurrect him.

        8) Character "dies" replace with new =
bot same personality...eventually
        people will forget you died and y=
ou can go back to your old form.

        Since most will never let their "=
favorite" character(s) die, I mean truly
        die, never come back like,=
 there's really very little new plotlines you can
        do with them with=
out repeating rehashed already done ones. Take for example
        the geot=
rons planing to attack the new cat faction....both factions will
        su=
rvive, I doubt either player who controls the majority of bots in either
  =
      faction is gonna let their characters get anywhere near killed.

    =
    And what's to stop this from happening if a restart/sequel DOES occur? =
The
        role-playing by some will still stink, characters will still be=
 incapable of
        dying and given another year or so all plotlines for =
THAT game will be
        starting to repeat. While I still do believe a re=
start/sequel is in order I
        think the role-playing problem needs add=
ressing first to stop a repeat of
        what's happening to NBW.



     =

ire several things to happen:

        > 3) A means to stor=

tart us all off (the story should provide that).
        > 6) Implementatio=
n of new rules, some of which have been, and are

        > 7) other stuff that could be written =
if I wasn't so tired.
        >

people voting anti-restart that I'd
        > anticpated, I'll ask everyone=

        >
        > Would it be favourab=
le to have a sequel instead of a restart?
